title: Node Type Header Icons
competitiveRationale: Milanote shows type-specific icons on card headers for quick visual identification. Our nodes have the icon imported (via lucide-react) but not all display it prominently. Adding a consistent small type icon in the top-left of each node improves scanning speed.
objective: Ensure all node components display their type icon (from lucide-react) in a consistent position - top-left corner, 14px size, with muted opacity (0.5) so it doesn't compete with content. Nodes that already import and display their icon should have their icon styling normalized. Nodes missing a visible type icon should get one added.

pattern.description: Each node already imports its type icon from lucide-react (e.g., CheckSquare for TodoNode, MessageSquare for CommentNode). Add or normalize a small icon display in the top-left area of the node.
pattern.notes: Check each node's existing layout - some may already show the icon. If the icon is already visible, normalize the styling (size 14, opacity 0.4). If a node uses the icon only in import but not in JSX, add a subtle display. Use the icon already imported - do NOT add new icon imports. The icon uses: TodoNode=CheckSquare, CommentNode=MessageSquare, CodeBlockNode has no specific icon import for display (skip or use Code from lucide if already imported), ColorSwatchNode=Palette, GroupNode=check import, MapNode=check import, TripPlannerMapNode=check import, LinkNode=check import.

acceptanceCriteria: All 8 listed node files have a visible type icon in a consistent position
Icon size is 14px across all nodes
Icon opacity is 0.4 (subtle, non-competing with content)
Icons use already-imported lucide-react components (no new icon imports added)
Icon does not overlap with delete/star buttons
